posts.name: Bumper Fairy
posts.cooked:
Hello Michigan!

2960 Automation Nation will be holding a Bumper workshop at our lab in Birmingham, MI on the 23rd of January at 6PM. This originally was going to be a Bumper Marking workshop featuring our very own Bumper Fairy, but we have decided to add in some manufacturing stuff and of course a bunch of discussion about the new allowed materials and the other rules changes.

The general plan is to review the updated rules, hand around material samples, including materials that are not legal/not a good idea (to reduce confusion for rookies, etc), and discuss the copious work that has been done on impact resistance. Then move into basics of assembling a functional bumper. We will have samples made up and our “bumper library” of successes and epic fails will be available for checking out.

The second half of the evening will be about getting your numbers to stay put. Teams are invited to bring samples of your preferred bumper material and learn hands-on how to get numbers to stick. We will demonstrate iron-on vinyl and durable inking options and give you a chance to practice these methods. Believe it or not, there is a lot of science in heat-press vinyl and once you see what it is supposed to look like, well, your numbers will finally stick. You will learn how to test your material before marking it, how to plan for the best adhesion, and how to fix up the inevitable competition damage with little to no stress.

Please sign up on our Google Form - https://forms.gle/St3CWXxqpCAaJdXM6 - so we can have an idea how to plan for this. If there is a huge response, we will run a second session.

Also, if you have a hand-held heat press (Cricut mini to 12x9 or similar+pad), please bring it with you, we only have so many to share around. If you do not have bumper material or numbers yet, we will have some to share for a $5 donation.

Hope to see you all soon!

PS - if you want to come just to hang out, please do - but sign up so we know how many chairs to unfold.

posts.name: jaunvie
posts.cooked: Looking forward to exchanging techniques. Can’t wait.

posts.name: Bumper Fairy
posts.cooked: Noooooooo come on over! We absolutely are open to our “South FIM ” peeps.

posts.name: Rhys
posts.cooked: I’m very curious about bumpers I just might have to or send some members over

posts.name: Rhys
posts.cooked: Do you know how long it would last? or a rough estimate

posts.name: Bumper Fairy
posts.cooked: @Miller77 Two hours tops, but we are not planning on taking hostages so feel free to drop in. We are happy to have visitors and talk bimpers!
I was waiting to see if you were going to go to this lol
